intro: Pilocarpus, commonly known as jurema or piquant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and includes several species such as Pilocarpus microphyllus. The plant is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. The leaves and seeds of Pilocarpus are used in traditional medicine for their stimulant and anticholinergic properties.
